title: Understanding Replication
text: Replication in research refers to the process of conducting a study again to verify its results. It is a crucial part of the scientific method.

hintAnswer: To verify the reliability and validity of the study's findings
title: Purpose of Replication
text: Why is it important for a research study to be replicable?
choices: To verify the reliability and validity of the study's findings
To increase the sample size of the original study
To allow the original researcher to publish more papers
To ensure the study is published in a $$high-impact$$ journal

title: Defining Reliability and Validity
text: Reliability refers to the consistency of a measure, while validity refers to the accuracy of a measure.

hintAnswer: By confirming that the results are consistent across different trials
title: Ensuring Consistency
text: How does replication help in ensuring the reliability of a study?
choices: By confirming that the results are consistent across different trials
By increasing the number of variables tested

title: Understanding Validity
text: Validity ensures that the study measures what it is intended to measure.

hintAnswer: By verifying that the study accurately measures the intended variables
title: Confirming Accuracy
text: How does replication contribute to the validity of a study?
choices: By verifying that the study accurately measures the intended variables
